summary: This bill, the District of Columbia Zoning Commission Home Rule Act (H.R. 4088), aims to revise the composition of the District of Columbia Zoning Commission. It mandates that the commission consist solely of members appointed by the Government of the District of Columbia, removing federal officials currently involved. The bill also makes a conforming amendment to the State Department Basic Authorities Act of 1956 concerning the Board of Zoning Adjustment and foreign mission applications.
